content:
OutputCacheProfile Class

In this Article

Configures the output cache profile that can be used by the application pages. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class OutputCacheProfile : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement
  • OutputCacheProfile

Remarks

The OutputCacheProfile class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the add element of the outputCacheProfiles section in the caching section of a configuration file.

The OutputCacheProfile object centralizes frequently used configuration settings such as dependencies, cache location, and cache expiration time, eliminating the need to specify them on every page.

The OutputCacheProfile can be applied to a page using the CacheProfile attribute of the directive.

Note

The directive can override all the settings contained by an OutputCacheProfile object except for the Enabled attribute. This is to enable or disable the OutputCacheProfile without having to modify the directives in all the pages that might have overridden it.

The CacheDependency class monitors the dependencies so that when any cached item changes, the cached item will be automatically removed.

Constructors summary

OutputCacheProfile(String)

Initializes a new instance of the OutputCacheProfile class.

Properties summary

Duration

Gets or sets the time duration during which the page or control is cached.
Enabled

Gets or sets a value indicating whether caching is enabled.
Location

Gets or sets the output cache location.
Name

Gets or sets the OutputCacheProfile name.
NoStore

Gets or sets a value indicating whether secondary storage is enabled.
Properties
SqlDependency

Gets or sets the SqlDependency property.
VaryByContentEncoding

Gets or sets the semicolon-delimited set of content encodings to be cached.
VaryByControl

Gets or sets the VaryByControl property.
VaryByCustom

Gets or sets the VaryByCustom property.
VaryByHeader

Gets or sets the VaryByHeader property.
VaryByParam

Gets or sets the VaryByParam property.

Constructors

  • OutputCacheProfile(String)

    Initializes a new instance of the OutputCacheProfile class.

    public OutputCacheProfile (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name value to use.

Properties

  • Duration

    Gets or sets the time duration during which the page or control is cached.

    public int Duration { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The time duration in seconds.

    Remarks

    The Duration represents the time in seconds that the page or user control is cached. Setting this property establishes an expiration policy for HTTP responses from the page or control to which it applies and will automatically cause the caching of their output.

    Note

    The Duration must be defined in either the profile or the directive of a page using the profile.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Duration property. 

            ' Get the current Duration.
        Dim durationValue As Int32 = _
        outputCacheProfile.Duration
      
        ' Set the Duration.
      outputCacheProfile.Duration = 0
      

    
      // Get the current Duration.
      Int32 durationValue = 
          outputCacheProfile.Duration;

      // Set the Duration property to 0.
      outputCacheProfile.Duration = 0;
  • Enabled

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether caching is enabled.

    public bool Enabled { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if caching is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

    Remarks

    The Enabled property allows enabling or disabling the caching mechanism in one place only. It affects all the pages or controls that use this OutputCacheProfile.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Enabled property. 

            ' Get the current Enabled property.
        Dim enabledValue As [Boolean] = _
        outputCacheProfile.Enabled
      
        ' Set the Enabled property.
    outputCacheProfile.Enabled = False

    
    // Get the current Enabled.
   Boolean enabledValue = 
       outputCacheProfile.Enabled;

    // Set the Enabled.
    outputCacheProfile.Enabled = 
        false;
  • Location

    Gets or sets the output cache location.

    public System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation Location { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • OutputCacheLocation

      One of the OutputCacheLocation enumeration values. The default is Any.

    Remarks

    If Location is set to Any, the output cache can be located on the browser client, where the request originated; on a proxy server, or any other server, participating in the request; or on the server where the request was processed.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Location property. 

            ' Get the current Location.
        Dim locationValue _
        As System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation = _
        outputCacheProfile.Location
      
      ' Set the Location property to null.
        outputCacheProfile.Location = _
        System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation.Server
      

    
      // Get the current Location.
      System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation locationValue = 
          outputCacheProfile.Location;

      // Set the Location property to null.
      outputCacheProfile.Location = 
          System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation.Server;
  • Name

    Gets or sets the OutputCacheProfile name.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The OutputCacheProfile name.

    Remarks

    You use the Name to assign a value to the CacheProfile attribute of the directive if you want to apply the OutputCacheProfile values to a page or control.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Name property. 

            ' Get the current Name.
        Dim nameValue As String = _
        outputCacheProfile.Name
      
        ' Set the Name property.
        outputCacheProfile.Name = _
        String.Empty
      

    
      // Get the current Name.
      String nameValue = 
          outputCacheProfile.Name;

      // Set the Name.
      outputCacheProfile.Name = 
          string.Empty;
  • NoStore

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether secondary storage is enabled.

    public bool NoStore { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if secondary storage is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

    Remarks

    The page that has the NoStore property set to true issues a response specifying in its header to prevent secondary storage of sensitive information.

    Setting this attribute to true is equivalent to invoking the SetNoStore method during a Web request.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the NoStore property. 

            ' Get the current NoStore.
        Dim noStoreValue As [Boolean] = _
        outputCacheProfile.NoStore
      
        ' Set the NoStore property.
      outputCacheProfile.NoStore = False
      

    
      // Get the current NoStore.
      Boolean noStoreValue = 
          outputCacheProfile.NoStore;

      // Set the NoStore.
      outputCacheProfile.NoStore = false;
  • Properties
    protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • ConfigurationPropertyCollection

      To be added.

  • SqlDependency

    Gets or sets the SqlDependency property.

    public string SqlDependency { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The SqlDependency value.

    Remarks

    The SqlDependency defines a relationship between a Web application and an instance of SQL Server, allowing the detection of changes in the data at the server. The SqlDependency ensures that output cached pages are removed from the cache whenever the SQL table on which they depend changes.

    Note

    The SqlCacheDependency class monitors the table so that when the table changes, the item will be automatically removed from the Cache. This class cannot be inherited.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the SqlDependency property. 

            ' Get the current SqlDependency.
        Dim sqlDependencyValue As String = _
        outputCacheProfile.SqlDependency
      
        ' Set the SqlDependency.
        outputCacheProfile.SqlDependency = _
        String.Empty
      

    
      // Get the current SqlDependency.
      String sqlDependencyValue = 
          outputCacheProfile.SqlDependency;

      // Set the SqlDependency.
      outputCacheProfile.SqlDependency = 
          string.Empty;
  • VaryByContentEncoding

    Gets or sets the semicolon-delimited set of content encodings to be cached.

    public string VaryByContentEncoding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The list of content encodings.

    Remarks

    The VaryByContentEncoding settings are the same ones used by the VaryByContentEncoding attribute of the directive.

    VaryByContentEncoding is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

  • VaryByControl

    Gets or sets the VaryByControl property.

    public string VaryByControl { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The VaryByControl value.

    Remarks

    The VaryByControl is a semicolon-delimited set of IDs of controls to be cached.

    For more information, see Caching Multiple Versions of User Control Output.

    Note

    The VaryByControl settings are the same ones used by the VaryByControls attribute of the directive.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the VaryByControl property. 

            ' Get the current VaryByControl.
        Dim varyByControlValue As String = _
        outputCacheProfile.VaryByControl
      
        ' Set the VaryByControl.
        outputCacheProfile.VaryByControl = _
        String.Empty
      

    
      // Get the current VaryByControl.
      String varyByControlValue = 
          outputCacheProfile.VaryByControl;

      // Set the VaryByControl.
      outputCacheProfile.VaryByControl = 
          string.Empty;
  • VaryByCustom

    Gets or sets the VaryByCustom property.

    public string VaryByCustom { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The VaryByCustom value.

    Remarks

    The VaryByCustom can be any text that represents custom output-caching requirements. If a custom string is entered, you must override the GetVaryByCustomString method in the application's Global.asax file.

    Note

    The VaryByCustom settings are the same ones used by the VaryByCustom attribute of the directive.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the VaryByCustom property. 

            ' Get the current VaryByCustom.
        Dim varyByCustomValue As String = _
        outputCacheProfile.VaryByCustom
      
        ' Set the VaryByCustom property.
        outputCacheProfile.VaryByCustom = _
        String.Empty
      

    
      // Get the current VaryByCustom.
      String varyByCustomValue = 
          outputCacheProfile.VaryByCustom;

      // Set the VaryByCustom.
      outputCacheProfile.VaryByCustom = 
          string.Empty;
  • VaryByHeader

    Gets or sets the VaryByHeader property.

    public string VaryByHeader { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The VaryByHeader value.

    Remarks

    The VaryByHeader is a semicolon-delimited set of headers used to vary the cached output. These are HTTP headers associated with the request. For more information, see Caching Multiple Versions of a Page.

    Note

    The VaryByHeader settings are the same ones used by the VaryByHeader attribute of the . Varying by all headers by setting the value of "*" is not recommended. It can result in cache overflow or a denial of service attack on the Web server.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the VaryByHeader property. 

            ' Get the current VaryByHeader.
        Dim varyByHeaderValue As String = _
        outputCacheProfile.VaryByHeader
      
        ' Set the VaryByHeader.
        outputCacheProfile.VaryByHeader = _
        String.Empty
      

    
      // Get the current VaryByHeader.
      String varyByHeaderValue = 
          outputCacheProfile.VaryByHeader;

      // Set the VaryByHeader.
      outputCacheProfile.VaryByHeader = 
          string.Empty;
  • VaryByParam

    Gets or sets the VaryByParam property.

    public string VaryByParam { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The VaryByParam value.

    Remarks

    The VaryByParam is a semicolon-delimited set of parameters used to vary the cached output. It allows varying the cached output by GET query string or form POST parameters. For instance, you can vary the user-control output to the cache by specifying the user-control name along with either a query string or a form POST parameter. For more information, see Caching Multiple Versions of User Control Output.

    The VaryByParam setting must be defined in either the profile or the directive of the page using the profile.

    Note

    The VaryByParam settings are the same ones used by the VaryByParam attribute of the . Varying by all parameters by setting the value of "*" is not recommended. It can result in cache overflow or a denial of service attack on the Web server.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the VaryByParam property. 

            ' Get the current VaryByParam property.
        Dim varyByParamValue As String = _
        outputCacheProfile.VaryByParam
      
        ' Set the VaryByParam property.
        outputCacheProfile.VaryByParam = _
        String.Empty
      

    
      // Get the current VaryByParam.
      String varyByParamValue = 
          outputCacheProfile.VaryByParam;

      // Set the VaryByParam.
      outputCacheProfile.VaryByParam = 
          string.Empty;
